reviews.review_msg: if you like public speaking/want to be an esl teacher, you should take LING 362 with him (in fact, he is the only one who teaches LING 362 at sfu). he is definitely a tough grader and you would get your points deducted even for the very tiny things. so, MAKE SURE to follow his instructions, visit his office hours, and put as much effort as you can

This is a great class that teaches valuable public speaking, and presentation skills. Professor gives specific feedback, marks harshly. Do something wrong and will be penalized. Sometimes intimidating. His lecture slides are basically his speech ( good/ bad?).  But each presentation is 2030% of your grade. DO NOT go over time. PRACTICE A LOT.

He seems tough and unfriendly but if you are willing to stop by his office hours often, you will find him helpful. This course does not require too much of work in general. English is not my first language and I did not study much for the MT, still I got a B-. Now I am able to speak in front of the class. I love it!
Really good at getting the material across. Just don't take if you're looking for an easy credit. For LING362 he expects a lot out of you.

nice + funi guy...well prepared + organized...will help sort out any problems w/ the materials as long as u'll willing to ask...he's a tough, but fair marker...if u've been to his lectures then u'r already bound to pass...good teaching style...won't put u to sleep for sure~
the best prof i've had at sfu. probably the best prof i've ever had in my post-secondary education. excellent lecturer, his notes are very helpful, and he's well-prepared for class.
She can be nice but when she marks students assignment, always give low marks and never provide clear instruction so we don't know what she expects unless we see our grade.  Avoid her if you can.

PROS: Super friendly & knowledgeable; fast emails; optional participation; no exams; sticks to rubric. CONS: Sad if u dont participate; lectures sometimes feel unrelated to assignments; slow marker. TIPS FOR A+: start hw early; run ur ideas by her; do an upper division writing course first; follow rubric. Easy A+ for good writers. Hard otherwise.

She can be nice but at the same time, she has a bit of an attitude especially when no one does her optional activities that take so long to complete. She is a very slow marker with the final grades being released first then only the other grades so we didn't know how we did most of the time.

Dr. Wong is very unorganized and her grading criteria is very unclear. In this class, we had to record 5 10-minute teaching practices which took about 3 hours each to complete and they were only worth 1-2% each. Unfortunately she teaches all the TESL courses so if you are doing the certificate, there is no other professor.

I thought this was a great class for students who are seeking to become ESL teachers. You can tell that Susan is very interested and has years of experience in this area. She gives GREAT feedback on your work. It is true that she is a bit of a hard marker, but she tells you ahead of time what information to focus on for tests. TAKE THIS COURSE!
Couldn't find a more sweet person than susan! too bad she's a tough marker, and her tests are a little bit hard.

Dr Wong is very helpful, knowledgeable, and genuinely interested in teaching. She is also quite down to earth. Rubrics and feedback are sufficiently thorough yet concise. Scoring high on assignments is easy if you put the time in.
